cochar package

cochar.cochar module¶

Call of Cthulhu character generator

Example:

>>> Character()
class cochar.cochar.Character(year: int = 1925, age: Optional[str] = None, sex: Optional[str] = None, first_name: Optional[str] = None, last_name: Optional[str] = None, country: str = 'US', occupation: str = 'optimal', occupation_points: Optional[int] = None, hobby_points: Optional[int] = None, characteristics: Optional[dict] = None, luck: Optional[int] = None, skills: Optional[dict] = None, combat_values: Optional[dict] = None, weights: bool = True)¶

Bases: object

MAX_AGE: int = 90¶
MIN_AGE: int = 15¶
OCCUPATIONS_GROUPS: list = [['antiquarian', 'clergy', 'librarian', 'journalist', 'engineer', 'doctor of medicine', 'missionary', 'parapsychologist', 'author', 'lawyer', 'professor'], ['artist', 'zealot', 'musician'], ['artist', 'police detective', 'athlete', 'tribe member', 'farmer', 'musician', 'police officer', 'military officer', 'pilot', 'private investigator', 'criminal', 'drifter', 'soldier'], ['dilettante', 'entertainer', 'zealot', 'drifter'], ['police detective', 'athlete', 'tribe member', 'farmer', 'police officer', 'military officer', 'private investigator', 'criminal', 'drifter', 'soldier']]¶

filter_skills(_skills: dict) → Dict[str, int]¶

Filter out all skills with basic value form given dict.

>>> example_dict = {'psychoanalysis': 1, 'language (spanish)': 66}
>>> filter_skills(example_dict)
{'language (spanish)': 66}
property first_name: str¶
classmethod generate_character(*args, **kwargs)¶
static generate_first_name(year: int, sex: str, country: str, weights: bool) → str¶

Generate First Name. Return random first name for the given parameters This method is not recomended as it initialize a Character() class. For faster generation use modeule randname

Parameters

  • year (int) – year of the data set with names (if data set not available use a closes available data set)

  • sex (str) – name gender, available options [‘M’, ‘F’, ‘N’, None]

  • country (str) – name country

  • weights (bool) – if true, take under account popularity of names. [default: True]

Returns

first name

Return type

str

static generate_last_name(year: int, sex: str, country: str, weights: bool) → str¶

Generate Last Name. Return random last name for the given parameters This method is not recomended as it initialize a Character() class. For faster generation use modeule randname

Parameters

  • year (int) – year of the data set with names (if data set not available use a closes available data set)

  • sex (str) – name gender, available options [‘M’, ‘F’, ‘N’, None]

  • country (str) – name country

  • weights (bool) – If true, take under account popularity of names. [default: True]

Returns

last name

Return type

str
